post_title: Community-driven Map annotations
post_body:
Hi everyone

Since the release of the new map annotations feature, I've been working on annotations for each map.

My hopes are that these lineups are regulary updated as utility goes in and out of meta.

Let me know your thoughts, and hopefully this is useful for some people.

- [Release page for latest version](https://github.com/ReneRebsdorf/CS2-annotations/releases)
- [CS-Annotations GitHub page](https://github.com/ReneRebsdorf/CS2-annotations)

post_title: Posture
post_body:
I've been really bad lately and I noticed that I just can't sit comfortably and play. Every single round I change how I sit and every single position has it's problems. I change the posture mainly because my hand is shaky for some reason and sens feels either too slow or too fast. I cannot find the middle sens that I actually feel.

I play 800DPI and my sens varies from 0.85 to 1.1  
and I simply cannot find a middle spot. I'm playing CS for 12 years now and only lately I have this problem (idk why).

I try to adjust my chair height, distance from monitor, my arm stretch, whatever that I will find comfortable, but nothing seems comfortable. I even changed my mouse glides and mousepad, still it feels very uncomfortable to aim. I am just super shaky while aiming. 

**Can this be just a "focus" problem? Or maybe there is something else that I may not know. How to solve this?**

post_title: CS2 input spikes. CAn someone try to help me out please?
post_body:
Hi community,

I have a question. For the past 2-3 months, I’ve had a big problem with spikes in **CS2**. Normally, my input latency is around **4-5 ms**, but I get random spikes to **11-14 ms**, and the game starts to feel really bad. I consistently have over **280 FPS** (my monitor is 280 Hz, **Alienware AW2723DF**), but the game starts to drop after I’m 4–5 minutes into a match.

I’ve already tried everything:

* I repasted my **CPU** and **GPU**. Temps are fine: **65°C (CPU)** and **68°C (GPU)**.
* CS2 is set to **high priority**, and I’ve debloated Windows 11.
* I’m playing on **1440x1440** with almost everything on **low**. I usually get over **300 FPS**, but during the input lag spikes, FPS drops to around **180–220 FPS** at the same time.

I also enabled **G-Sync** with **V-Sync (Fast)** in NVCP and set an FPS cap of **370 (NVCP) and fps\_max 0 in game**. I’ve even added `-noreflex` to the launch options, but nothing seems to help.

This is my PC setup:

* **GPU:** Gigabyte RTX 3070
* **CPU:** AMD Ryzen 7 5800X
* **Motherboard:** Asus ROG STRIX X570-E
* **Cooling:** NZXT Kraken 253 AIO
* **RAM:** 32GB Corsair Vengeance RGB (3200 MHz)
* **PSU:** Corsair RM750X White
* **Storage:** 2x 1TB NVMe M.2 SSDs

Does anyone know any fixes or ideas for what I can try? I’m really stuck at this point. Thanks for the help!

post_title: Game stuttering
post_body:
Hi, my game started to stutter out of nowhere probably 2 weeks ago. It is super weird, because it is not consistent. I can play with no issues for a round or two, and then stuttering comes back with no apparent reason for a couple of rounds. When it stutters I teleport back and forth or has some kind of lags or missed frames. I have no idea what happened, my drivers are up to date, I checked for files compatibility and every things looks ok. Anyone else expirienced something like this? Anyone has a fix maybe?

Edit: I solved it(?). Just reinstalled the game and everything is fine for now

[This is how it looks like](https://reddit.com/link/1h3lky6/video/gvb88socm34e1/player)

post_title: Faceit or Premier? A Cheater-Wary Newcomer’s Dilemma
post_body:
Hey there, everyone! I wanted to share a bit of my story with you. Fair warning: it might trigger some of you—but hear me out.

Back in 2013, I bought CS:GO on my main account. I was just a 13-year-old kid with zero gaming skills and a severe case of stupidity. So, what did I do? I cheated. Five games in, boom—VAC banned. Lesson learned, right? (Yeah, I know. Dumb move, but we grow.)

Fast forward to 2021. I hadn’t touched CS-like games since then—none of that strafing, spraying, or “aim god” mechanics. Instead, I was into mil-sim games, where patience and realism take center stage. But I got curious and decided to try Valorant. Played for about a year, hit Platinum, then eventually dropped it.

Now we’re in 2024. I bit the bullet, created a new account, and bought CS2 to see what I’d been missing. And let me tell you—it’s fantastic. Way better than Valorant, which feels like a CS clone with extra fluff.

Over the past five years, I’ve heard so much about CS from my roommate, who’s an ex-semi-pro. He’s been my unofficial coach, giving me tips on lineups, positioning, and how not to suck.

**The Problem?**  
The game is great—it’s fast, thrilling, and exactly what I wanted. But there’s one glaring issue: *cheaters*. In almost every game, there’s at least one dude toggling hacks on and off. It’s a buzzkill. My roommate suggested I try Faceit for a cleaner experience, but I’ve also heard good things about Premier.

**So, Here’s My Dilemma:**  
Which one should I commit to—Faceit or Premier? I’m still new to CS mechanics, apart from my time in Valorant. I’m looking for a place to learn and improve without constantly running into cheaters.

**What I’d Like to Know:**

1. Which platform is better for a relatively new player?
2. Any tips for avoiding cheaters and keeping the game enjoyable?
3. What should I focus on as a beginner in CS?

Honestly, I just want to give this game a proper chance and make up for my past mistakes. Thanks in advance for any advice, and feel free to roast me for being a dumb kid back in the day—I’ve earned it.

post_title: What is the walk command??
post_body:
Everytime I open my game my walk key is unbound and I tried to just bind it in my autoexec but I cant figure out what the command for walk is. Can someone please help me! XD

This is what I have in my autoexec

    bind "LSHIFT" "+sprint"

  
This is what I had before 

    bind "LSHIFT" "+walk"
    

Am I not using the correct way of spelling shift??

post_title: .vpk error
post_body:
Yo,

since the shanghai update I'm getting .vpk errors on maps.

Means I wanna join a game and it crashes, saying for exmaple: error dust\_2.vpk corrupted. Then goes to verify the integrity of gamefiles for quite a while before I can join back. Right now it doesn't even do that, I'm just sitting here, knowing I'll be banned for half an hour.

  
Anyone else with this issue?
